page.title: 19Hop Kilns Project
page.content: The Hop Kilns were built in{1886} for the purpose of drying hops. The kilns and the land were owned by Mr. Walter Tice. The{restoration project}was started 8 years ago and will probably take another 6 years to finish. The land and the kilns were purchased for Â£16,000 and already more than{Â£55,000} have been spent on the restoration.The money was raised by the local people. The first rooms in the restored building were opened on{4th May 1985 } by Mrs.Virginia Bottomley who was the local Member of Parliament. { The Hop Kilns are now used}by play groups for pre-scholl children,wives groups,an American Football team and as a practise hall for a local band.
